intro: Grumilea subsuccosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved grumifolium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, succulent stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Grumilea subsuccosa is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
